messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: cheap flights
messages.msgSnippet: Are you looking to book a room in Las Vegas?  We had some good luck last time we stayed there are year or two ago by going to the about.com area on LV and
messages.messageBody:
Are you looking to book a room in Las Vegas? We had some good luck last
time we stayed there are year or two ago by going to the about.com area on
LV and following some links there. We ended up getting a very nice room at
the Hyatt, just off the strip for $50.00 a night.

jocelyn
who both loves and hates Las Vegas

> From: Susan Bundlie <strandbe@...>
> Reply-To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Tue, 21 May 2002 11:39:02 -0500
> To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re: cheap flights
>
>
> On Tuesday, May 21, 2002, at 11:26 AM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
> wrote:
>
>> The airlines used to pay them
>> commissions, but this system recently changed. You're better off using
>> the
>> internet now. If he can fly on Tuesday or Wednesday, fares might be
>> cheaper.
>
> Okay, thanks a lot. Actually, he is flying on a Tuesday. I guess my idea
> of a cheap flight and the airlines' ideas differ somewhat.
>
> Booking a room is another adventure. I had just about settled on one and
> when I went back to the site to book it, the price had gone up $10! AUGH.
>
> Susan

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: cheap flights
messages.msgSnippet: On Tue, 21 May 2002 11:39:02 -0500 Susan Bundlie  ... idea ... Have you tried hotwire.com and priceline.com? If he s flexible about the
messages.messageBody:
On Tue, 21 May 2002 11:39:02 -0500 Susan Bundlie <strandbe@...>
writes:

> Okay, thanks a lot. Actually, he is flying on a Tuesday. I guess my
idea
> of a cheap flight and the airlines' ideas differ somewhat.

Have you tried hotwire.com and priceline.com? If he's flexible about the
times he leaves and arrives, they often save a lot... hotwire will just
show you the prices, and priceline has you put in your "bid" and then you
wait a half hour and see if you got it. Priceline also adds fees now...
and you can also book hotel rooms through both, and specify the area and
how many "stars", minimum. We got a really nice room throught priceline
when we went up to see Karin in Phoenix, I think it was a Howard
Johnson's, walking distance from the play we were seeing, and only $30.

Dar

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: cheap flights
messages.msgSnippet: On Tuesday, May 21, 2002, at 11:26 AM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com ... Okay, thanks a lot. Actually, he is flying on a Tuesday. I guess my idea of a cheap
messages.messageBody:
On Tuesday, May 21, 2002, at 11:26 AM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
wrote:

> The airlines used to pay them
> commissions, but this system recently changed. You're better off using
> the
> internet now. If he can fly on Tuesday or Wednesday, fares might be
> cheaper.

Okay, thanks a lot. Actually, he is flying on a Tuesday. I guess my idea
of a cheap flight and the airlines' ideas differ somewhat.

Booking a room is another adventure. I had just about settled on one and
when I went back to the site to book it, the price had gone up $10! AUGH.

Susan
